byline.contributor: Reporting was contributed by Al Baker, Benjamin Mueller, Kate Pastor and Noah Remnick. Elisa Cho contributed research.

abstract: New York City Police Officer Sherrod Stuart is shot in leg while responding to brawl in Mott Haven neighborhood of Bronx involving dozens of people that also results in at least five stabbings; Stuart and suspected gunman Christopher Rice, who is in critical condition, are hospitalized; Stuart is expected to recover.

headline.print_headline: An Officer Is Shot During a Brawl in the South Bronx
headline.main: New York Police Officer Is Shot Breaking Up a Brawl in the Bronx

keywords.value: Stuart, Sherrod (New York, NY, Police Officer)
keywords.name: persons

snippet: The officer was shot in the ankle and five people were stabbed early Saturday when a large brawl involving as many as 100 people erupted at what officials described as an illegal “jump-up” party.
lead_paragraph: The officer was shot in the ankle and five people were stabbed early Saturday when a large brawl involving as many as 100 people erupted at what officials described as an illegal “jump-up” party.
